intro: Stravadium acuminatum, commonly known as the sharp-lobed rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants known for their cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine environments. Its leaves are elongated and have serrated edges, while its flowers are small and yellowish-white in color. Stravadium acuminatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
